head.title: Metro Briefing | New York: Albany: State Gets $18.5 Million In Settlement

hedline.hl1: Metro Briefing | New York: Albany: State Gets $18.5 Million In Settlement

body.head.byline: By Tara Bahrampour (NYT) (Compiled by Anthony Ramirez)

abstract.p: New York State will distribute its $18.5 million share of lawsuit settlement to 106 health programs (S)

block.p: New York State will distribute its $18.5 million share of a lawsuit settlement to 106 health programs, Attorney General Eliot Spitzer announced yesterday. In October 2000, Hoffmann-La Roche, BASF and four other companies agreed to pay $225 million to 21 states after being accused of fixing prices. New York's share will go to programs involving prenatal care, nutrition and other health measures. The largest allotment, $600,000, will go to the New York State Coalition Against Domestic Violence; the largest allotment in New York City, $300,000, will go to Food For Survival, a food-distribution program in the Bronx.

New York State will distribute its $18.5 million share of a lawsuit settlement to 106 health programs, Attorney General Eliot Spitzer announced yesterday. The largest allotment, $600,000, will go to the New York State Coalition Against Domestic Violence; the largest allotment in New York City, $300,000, will go to Food For Survival, a food-distribution program in the Bronx.
